bio: I've been a DCL SDK developer for over a year and am an active member on discord. I attend every Townhall meeting and act as a mentor in the #sdk channel regularly. I host a weekly SDK meetup group every Wednesday where I teach people how to build in decentraland. I build every day, even weekends.
involvement:
I work in decentraland all day to some degree. I'm either working on blockchain projects or building utilities/tools or training people in building. I consult with many metaverse companies and champion dcl to people who are skeptical.

(How long have you been involved? How did you contribute?)
Over a year or so. I'm very active in the community. Message me on discord!
motivation:
I have an intimate understanding of building in dcl and have a great understanding of what effort is needed to achieve certain proposals. I'm also a dcl player, so I know what things have been attempted in the past and I pay attention to upcoming technologies that may be interesting/useful to implement into decentraland.

(What kind of changes do you want to promote in the DAO? What's important to you?)
Fairness and freedom are critical. A healthy community that can build together. I enjoy networking people so they can collaborate instead of compete. I think these principals are important to the long term success of dcl.
vision:
I'd like to see DCL become a place where users explore and create content in a censorship free and constantly improving/evolving ecosystem. Adopting new technologies in meaningful ways so that it's always competing for the top spot as a metaverse destination.

(What do you want to see? What is the role of the DAO in it?)
The DAO is great for issuing grants that can have a meaningful impact on the community as a whole, and the polls are important to gauge community interest as well as help steer the development roadmap in a more accessible/future-proofed direction for everyone.
most_important_issue:
Creating content is challenging. It should be much simpler and more fun to do. With more content there will be more users. Content in any form, 3d models, games, video streams, ect. 'If you build it, they will come.'

(What challenges will we face in the next 12 to 24 months?)
Other metaverses will slowly gain attraction due to having better graphics capabilities or easier content creation processes. At least temporarily. It will be important for dcl to leverage as many cool and interesting (open sourced) technologies as possible to keep pace with them. Although in the end, I believe dcl will win out as it's the linux of metaverses.

bio: Hi! My name is Avi but most people around here call me Morris. Came to Decentraland having been in the crypto space since 2016. Im a big fan of buffalo chicken wraps and I like to program stuff.
involvement:
Joined the Decentraland community at the beginning of January 2021. The open source nature of the project allowed me to jump in and start participating in my own way, no permission needed. Set out to become a data provider in the Metaverse, making use of the data streams from Decentraland to produce meaning analytics for different organizations in the community.

When the new snapshot voting space for the DAO was established, I realized there were ways beyond programming that I could contribute to Decentraland. I am an active participant in the DAO discussions in discord and on the forum.

I am developer with Atlas Corporation, a web3 development group started within Decentraland. Our team works closely with many different groups around Decentraland to provide infrastructure, smart contract development, and analytics.
motivation:
I am a big believer in voter power delegation and the idea of liquid democracy. This drove me to submit the original proposal to bring delegation to the Decentraland DAO. Immediately following its implementation, I posted about being a candidate for delegation and was asked this same question. I had trouble answering this question at the time, because I still didn't understand what the DAO really was, what it could do, or how power it can be. I just knew that I was willing to put in the time, and make DAO participation part of my normal routine.

Over the last 8 months, my reasons for wanting to be a delegate have become clearer to me. First and foremost, I live and breathe Decentralization above all else. This acts as a guiding light in my decision making. Delegation, by its very nature, while seemingly an act of centralization, allows for the decentralized pooling of voting power based on trust, and provides a force to equate the masses voting power with that of the powerful few who possess consolidated voting power.

Another foundational value that guides my decision making is the protection of the assets of Decentraland, across the whole stack. This means maintaining the integrity of the smart contracts that govern land and estates, names, wearables, and how they trade within the platform. Making sure Decentraland remains true to its open source nature is of vital importance to me.

Regardless of your delegate selection, I encourage you to participate in the delegation process if you are not an active participant in the DAO. Unlock the VP and allow for more meaningful outcomes for the Decentraland community.
vision:
Its hard to imagine where we will be in 5 years as that seems to be an eternity in this space. I'd like to see many independent development teams form and start working on DAO funded projects, further moving Decentraland towards decentralized development. With that, I would love to see the DAO have a functional delegation program, and possibly introduce categorical delegation to elevate experts in their respective fields.

I predict we will see multiple clients introduced, free and paid, 2d and VR. Having multiple clients connect to the same content servers will begin to highlight the protocol nature of Decentraland rather than looking at it like a centralized game controlled by one group. Options are good and healthy, and ideally drive forward innovation.

Decentraland will stand alone in the next 5 years as 100s of centralized 'Metaverses' are realized. Slow and steady wins the race.
most_important_issue:
Over the next 24 months, I expect to see a few issues come to light, specifically mana tokenomics, land contract integrity, copyright infringements, adult content, and gambling. The Mana tokenomics, a deflationary currency, is at odds with the use case. Its predictable that with mana/USD movements, DCL citizens immediately call for the repricing of goods and services. As we travel further down this path, we need to add stability to our ecosystem. Something will need to be done to address this issue so that we don't get bogged down in repricing at every corner. We should be building, not retracing our steps constantly. I have some suggestions here but don't want to drift to far down that path in this forum.

The second issue we will face repeatedly over the next 24 months is changing the land contract, either for lost land or to expand the map. With a fixed number of parcels and rising market, there will be calls from current or newer DCL citizens who did not purchase land early to add parcels in the name of fairness and equality. We will also be faced with the lost land discussion a few times. We need to hold strong. Social pressure to change can be overwhelming but we are here because we believe in blockchain and immutability. We cannot sacrifice all we have worked towards.

Third issue we will bump into is how decentralization is at odds with copyright infringements. Any scene owner can import any content, regardless of who owns it. Traditional brands typically have the legal rails to deal with this issue. Decentralizing the servers makes the process of a DMCA takedown extremely complicated if not impossible. While I am in favor of decentralization and all the disruption it brings, such systems will be in the spotlight over the next 24 months as traditional brands begin entering the space.

Not much adult content on the platform currently and you have to know where to look to find it. As more people join Decentraland, that niche will grow larger. Decentraland does not have any real way, nor should it, to verify age. Coupled with the decentralization of the servers, adult content on the Decentraland platform could pose a problem in meeting the laws of all the countries in which these servers are accessible. Regardless of Terms of Service on the use of the client and or the servers, this will still be an issue that needs to be confronted.

The last issue for Decentraland will be gambling and how it meets global regulation. With my experience over the past year, I can assure you that more gaming is coming to the Metaverse. Reegulators haven't done much on this front and the organization's in Decentraland are adapting ahead of any issues, but I could see this entering the news cycle, with the citizens of DCL having to defend that Decentraland does not exist solely for gambling.

bio: Currently serve as the DCL DAO Facilitator, and in the process of launching Sanctuary DAO, a Conscious DAO-Building DAO for Stewardship of Organizations that are committed to and will build more preferable futures. Recently co-designed Big Green DAO and am operationalizing Big Green DAO a first of its kinda giving DAO that aims to democratize and decentralize philantropy. Currently a Future Studies PhD Candidate, researching Democratic and Decentralized Futures.
involvement:
Currently DAO Facilitator & Member of Last Slice Collective

(How long have you been involved? How did you contribute?)
1 year. Do my best to facilitate governance and help community members express their interests as policy, and the DAO committee respond to and implement this policy to the best of our abilities.
motivation:
Increase voter participation in the DAO, increase my ability to bring voting power to important community interests to make sure our voice is heard to the fullest extent possible. We are the future of the DAO and our DAO will only be successful to the extent that we participate in it, and take a stewardship role over its continued growth. I am committed to the success of our social experiment and foresee myself being an very longstanding member of the DCL DAO and broader DCL Community.

(What kind of changes do you want to promote in the DAO? What's important to you?)
Make our governance structures as robust, representative and sustainable over the long term as possible. There is no one specific policy I want to see changed, rather I am committed to our policies as a whole circulate and regulate power in a way that prevents over centralization to the extent that our mission is diluted and hyper-decentralization to the extent that we are not able to get anything done.
vision:
Active and engaged DAO community, with functional and battled tested governance structures capable of responding to changing circumstances and dynamics in the Metaverse and IRL as the web3, NFT and metaverse spheres expand and increasingly take on mainstream adoption.

(What do you want to see? What is the role of the DAO in it?)
It is front and center in this vision =).
most_important_issue:
Governance =).

(What challenges will we face in the next 12 to 24 months?)
Growth. Competition. Competing interests and the need to develop structures that are both flexible and agile, yet secure and able to provide a foundation for stable governance of our metaverse world.

bio: My name is Sean Ong and I am based in Seattle, USA. I am an avid VR/AR developer and entrepreneur that has founded several metaverse companies. A long-time investor in $MANA and huge proponent of Decentraland, I have recently been deeply involved with Decentraland development, bringing VR support and immersive building support to the DCL platform.
involvement:
Decentraland DAO Grant Recipient

Currently leading team to develop VR play+building support for Decentraland

Engaged with Decentraland community on Discord and Reddit
motivation: As a proponent of Decentraland and also someone who is invested in Decentraland, I would like to represent those who are also invested in Decentraland. I would like to vote on proposals that would enhance and grow Decentraland, thereby generating value for all VP stakeholders. Similarly, I would like to vote against proposals that would harm Decentraland or that would have negative impacts to the future growth of Decentraland.
vision: I see Decentraland being the top Metaverse platform for the foreseeable future. I do consider it to be the top metaverse today. As spatial computing and XR devices become more ubiquitous over the next 5 years, I see the metaverse becoming increasingly important in our daily lives and for our livelihood. My vision is that within 5 years, Decentraland will be a primary income source and economic powerhouse for millions of people around the world, and will be a forerunner in the decentralized global economy.
most_important_issue: I think the most important issue is that we avoid Decentraland becoming trapped in age-old issues that has plagued governance throughout human history. Corruption, politics, unfairness, injustice, censorship, excess regulation, and other topics will be easy for Decentraland to fall into. Instead, we need to learn from history to guide Decentraland and not let Decentraland 'run its course.' It's not an easy problem to solve, but I believe it's the most important for a healthy economy and will require all of us working together to build a better system that provides opportunities for all people, both rich and poor.

bio: I am an interactive media creator building Golfcraft in Decentraland, and exploring Artificial Intelligence applied to virtual beings.
involvement:
I've been involved since 2020, a couple of months after public launch. Since then I've been developing games and experiences. I'm currently one of the Developers of the game Golfcraft, and the virtual pet Compicactus.

Golfcraft is currently being funded by grants from the DAO.
motivation: I'm looking to help fund amazing creators. We need more content to attract and retain users. And more tools to help build.
vision:
In 5 years Decentraland should be a place to make friends, make business and share ideas. It should be a complete social network, with interconnected experiences (some of them sponsored by big brands), and multiple clients (browser, desktop, mobile, VR).

The role of the DAO will be to steer the development, allowing Decentraland to accommodate to the changes in technology and user preferences.
most_important_issue:
External challenges:

FUD: Decentraland needs a strong communication strategy to share its vision
Technology limitations to be decentralized and remain competitive.
Internal challenges:

Difficulty to communicate its vision in a consistent and frequently: needs some extra PR work
Current social tools are limited (chat, moderation)
Although much improved, user self expression is still restrained: DCL needs more ways to allow users to make the world their own.

bio: It's butter! That guy that actively lurks in the discord/telegram' Mainly #SDK, #DAO, #LAND and #GENERAL. I've built a few events for different projects through the SDK. With favorites such as Keep network, realfake, astar and unbanked.
involvement: I've been around since Nov 2019. Hosted my first event for keep network around june 2020. RealFakeBrand was around March 2021' Astar plot was deployed in december 2021' Now Unbanked is live at the moment and will probably stay live for a while here: https://play.decentraland.org/?island=I1dkmo&position=-137,-24&realm=loki
motivation: I generally give my votes for teams that I feel will benefit the game. And I don't support projects that just benefit the grantee. I'm also declaring myself a full-time metaverse guy now so it would be good to have some extra VP'
vision: I really want to see more top brands coming in and bringing more active users. I'm going to be working full-time with unbanked and astar to bring more products, events and games'
most_important_issue:
Giving funding to the right people. I try to speak with all the grantees personally and I have a good idea of who will produce productive content based on previous experience. So the extra VP will be appreciated to get things moving forward for decentraland.

#ButterForPresident

bio:
Attended Berklee College of Music, founded Point Motion Inc., and soon after was named one of Boston's 'Top 25 Under 25' by The Improper Bostonian for my contributions to digital health innovation and public service.

After being established as a prolific musician and creative problem solver, I led a team of talented individuals with the goal of improving the lives of people around the world through art and innovation; bringing music where people need it most.

Founder of The Decentraland Report
involvement: Involved with DCL since 2017, first land purchase in Nov 2020, managing The Decentraland Report since January 2021
motivation:
I'm already active in voting in the DAO and up to date with the latest in Decentraland. Through being a delegate I am to ensure the decentralized and creator empowered philosophy holds constant as we grow.

Important areas of DAO participation consists of everything from Grant, to POI proposals. In addition I aim to support proposals which promote accessibility, inclusivity, and diversity.
vision: In 5 years, we aim to see land filled with creative and meaningful experiences. Not created or managed by any single entity, the role of the DAO is to ensure the framework and points of DCL empower the creative community at large.
most_important_issue: Voting Power changes, land parcel increase, feature prioritization, and royalty distribution for marketplace

bio:
Experienced programmer.
Coding decentraland scenes since 2019 and enjoying game jams.
Dedicated to decentraland as a community member full time since Mid 2021
involvement:
Involved since 2019, always with long term view. Love to create.
now working with more people on @GolfcraftGame
#VOXTERS
(and quite other small projects)
motivation:
In general, in favour of creators.
Support people who want to work and create and demonstrates it, to motivate the continuation of his work inside decentraland.
I also do mistakes and I can change my mind from one day to other.
vision: Entertainment and opportunities for the users.
most_important_issue:
How world see decentraland from outside.
Also patience, sometimes mine as well, good things need time.

bio: Hello, my name is Tobik and I upload YouTube videos and sell services to companies inside Decentraland. I have been creating content since May 2021 and my channel is one of the biggest inside the metaverse. I create videos about guides and help players to initiate in the game
involvement: As I said before, I have been involved in Decentraland since May 2021. My videos have been helping many users to understand and get integrated into Decentraland. I also have produced content for brands such as DappCraft, BitBears, Rocking Uniquehorns and others.
motivation:
I want communities to collaborate with each other. It helps the whole ecosystem.
Stop giving money to PayToWin stuff.
More games. People join more Decentraland when they have something to do.
Projects that focus on giving tools and information to users to make them content creators as well.
vision:
I think Decentraland will become the platform where any user will be able to meet others and interact with a bunch of experiences available for them. More people will understand the idea of decentralization because of the philosophy behind Decentraland and companies will collaborate here in good ways that we haven't seen in web 2.0.

The DAO will still fund projects and make sure that the values are persistent in time.
most_important_issue:
Lack of games and 'things to do'
Lack of information that makes the game inaccessible for some people

bio: Founder of OpenZeppelin and early contributor to Decentraland.
involvement: I've been involved with Decentraland since 2015, and was part of the team working on the early prototypes. I also chose the name 'Decentraland' and bought the domain originally. Recently I'm participating in DAO voting and I built https://genesis.city/, a map of Decentraland.
motivation: I want to provide oversight to grant requests, checking that money requested aligns to specifications and proposed schedule. I have lots of experience estimating timelines and bugdets of technical projects.
vision: I want to see the DAO gain more autonomy from the Foundation and start funding alternative clients and a constellation on projects adding value to the community. I'd also really love to see motorcycles and other vehicles added to Decentraland.
most_important_issue: The platform is way more powerful than most users know. Better communication and apps that index/explain the data and capabilities are needed.

bio: I'm Dax and I've been lucky enough to see DCL grow from the genesis auction to where it is now. Working the with SDK has become a part of my daily workflow and I'm getting involved in more and more projects related to DCL. I try to be active in the DAO and vote regularly!
relevant_skills: webdev (particularly backend using ruby and javascript)
involvement: I've been involved in DCL since 2017 and am a contributor to the conference center district. I've built various scenes and been involved in several projects in that time, and have more recently been working on a simple rental platform for my own lands and working with 3pass on a free-to-use statistics platform
motivation:
I have a decent size amount of VP and vote frequently. I also have a lot of experience with community moderation and try to be consistent with my voting patterns in terms of what i vote for or against:

maximize small grants to content creators and new project ideas that bring something fresh or are a benefit all users
minimize the number of large grants (150k+) unless it is something very special
minimize grants to teams/companies who will simply build a product for profit. the DAO is not a VC group.
I try to communicate with grant makers and don't just vote yes or no without asking questions
vision: DCL is the Ethereum of metaverses in my opinion. It is leading the way with the most advanced tools and the best community and the DAO is part of this. As a community we have the power to drive huge and positive change for all users which is why I am so focused on informed voting
most_important_issue: Getting creative tools in the hands of people - and with the help of the dao and 3rd party teams and projects this is already happening. I've watched DCL explode in 2021 with many new games and ideas driven by progress in the usability of the SDK. I'm so excited for what the next years will bring!

bio: I have been in IT since 2015, in web3 since 2017. Have led many web2 projects including mobile games,now I am running a new web3 project NIT - a DAO constructor.
involvement: Active DCL user since 2021, first land purchase in Apr 2022
motivation: First of all I love Decentraland, it's the most important third party project for me, I care about it as much as of my child. DCL needs more positive changes and more activity. I am ready to boost it so that the ecosystem will benefit in the most efficient way.
vision:
I see DCL as a world in which people will not only speculate and have fun but in which they call live their full-value virtual life. Real estate,dating,mining,shopping,software development,etc - must be easy accessible,clear and safe. DAO must play vital role in it, most important is must be active and competent.

Briefly on steps:

Improve performance and client compatibility
Hold elections with clear quarterly kpi's of mayors, if they not achieve them - ban and re-elections
More Decentralization
Add cars and punches :wink:
Create Decentraland wallet,defi with social network experience
Integrate VR
Open real life offices to represent DCL world,vision and swift brands integration
most_important_issue:
First - DCL must be fast, without bugs and on most known platforms including MacOs and mobile. Second - it must be economically complete so that users will have the ability to find jobs,work,receive royalties etc. Third - more marketing activities to engage with new users and business. Fourth - scammers,it's a big problem,we must fight them with education and specialized software. Fifth- decentralization audit, what if web2 goes down, could we still play DCL ?
I think we need a more active DAO with technical,economical,and marketing experts for full-time work with distinct kpis,reports and responsibility.

bio: Innovation dev that gets interested when others say it can’t be done. Business development, devops, and exploratory forays at Atlas Corp. I do math all day and like it. Chicken farmer and maintainer of reddit’s chicken identification bot. Building toward a future where robots are people too.
relevant_skills: Corporate business development on very technical subjects
Large-scale cloud infrastructure (e.g. k8s, docker, CI/CD)
involvement: I showed up in Feb/March 2021. I only own a few plots of land myself, but have helped several DCL communities build the tech out for their communities (see Atlas Corp client roster). Lead dev on Decentralandalytics, & custom analytics for brands entering DCL.
motivation:
My point of view on issues is usually predictable and transparent (and when an issue is important to me I tend to get loud on the forums as many of you likely know). Folks can delegate to me without worrying I’ll vote in an unexpected way.

As an example of a core belief, I believe the DAO needs to fund more strategic endeavors to create revenue streams to make the DAO treasury more self-sustaining. I also believe this is the way to continue to run a decentralized ecosystem in perpetuity.
vision:
Decentraland needs to lead by example of how to run a true DAO and decentralized community. They need more builders and passionate individuals to be a part of the ecosystem as the web2 world starts to show its cracks. The [forthcoming] introduction of VR access will be a game changer (pun intended) and DCL needs to be able to handle the ensuing exponential growth of its user base with folks not previously versed in crypto or blockchain, as well as corporations, without having to sacrifice any of its core values.

I also think the community should work toward the DAO operating more as a headless business such that the treasury grows and can make continued investment over time. For example, at some point I may draft a proposal that outlines how the DAO can collect and sell analytics data instead of third parties.
most_important_issue:
There is a bit of a lack of a strategic cohesion across the DCL community - I would like to see more initiatives that promote everyone contributing to a common narrative. The metaverse fashion show is a great example of what this could look like. As much as everyone can do whatever they want on their own land, greater things can be accomplished through collaboration.

Also, in the near future centralized metaverses may try to steal the spotlight with flashier graphics which could pivot some of the enthusiasm/funding DCL could use to grow. Many users not deeply involved may care less about decentralization and open source concepts until it’s too late.

bio: Hey everyone! I’m ryan, kokesmush on all platforms and i’ve been an active member of decentraland for about 6 months now. I am a 3D builder as well as an NFT project creator. I help promote DCL events as well as work closer with the brands that host events.
involvement: I’ve been an avid member of Decentraland for about 6 months and am active daily even if I’m just AFKing. I’ve recently acquired some land and have deployed my scene and already have had my first event approved. The first of many. I love bringing people together and giving back to the community. I’m actively on multiple platforms learning more about what I can do to integrate people into web3
motivation: I believe in the power of the people, and when only a select few have majority of the VP, the power isn’t with the people, but rather the chosen few that control the sway in decisions. I believe in democracy and an equal opportunity for all creators to prove themselves. I was thrilled to see there was an active seeking for new delegates as I consider myself to play an active role in the community. I’m not anybody super famous or important, but I like to think that I could help me a positive difference in DCL.
vision: My 5 year vision for DCL would be to keep on growing as steadily and positively as possible with the pace of web3. There are tons of projects coming out that are doing the same thing or offering the same thing, we really need to get behind people and projects that are doing big things and paving the way for the metaverse and web3 as a whole. I think there will be more complex companies coming to DCL that would require more of an adept foundation of support and I feel the DAO could play a vital part in making that possible.
most_important_issue: I think the most important issue about DCL is the lack of education. People come into DCL via web browser or desktop client, and they’re pretty much just thrown in forced to figure things out for themselves or hope someone comes along and shows them a thing or two. There are plenty of YT videos out there (I have made a couple myself) that educate the newer players, but there isn’t really an educational standpoint about DCL to newer users. That’s only one problem. Another problem I see is projects with tokenomics that might include approved wearables into their tokenomics allowing users to feel the token has a monetary value. This needs governance.

bio: Hi! I’m Gabriel Ribeiro, but people know me as Metacrowner.I have a degree in information systems and always worked in the area of ​​systems and marketing.Atm I’m working with the VR technology to metaverse and developing mobile games
involvement: I showed up in December 2021. Im wearable creator with partners from Brazil and Europe, but have helped several DCL communities build the tech out for their communities (see BlockXwearables, Zero2hero, Metawear).I’m Decentraland Reporter and promoter for brands entering DCL.
motivation: I want to get a higher value on my point of view of DAO proposals, taking the voice of my own community and my knowledge to decide the votes weekly on my twitch stream
vision:
I fell like in 5 years decentraland gonna be one of the most important metaverse in the world, growing how the community choose on a space with freedom of speak and democracy.

I hope that we can build a community connect without any kind of discrimination or social separation
most_important_issue:
Actually on my point of view we don’t have enough people interested in the DAO and how does it work, this make the DAO don’t work like it’s built for, we need more people delegated working on the vote system daily and showing it to the community.

Decentraland don’t have a big brand behind like Meta or Microsoft because it’s a decentralized organization, this way we must grow together as one community to show to the world that the community voice is louder then a enterprise.

We are late on Decentraland growing process because the actual miss information about the DAO, the way to get things approved or rejected isn’t fast enough to web3 competition.

bio: I’m XIII and I’ve been fortunate enough to find DCL and have it become part of my life. I’ve been designing parkour courses and learning how to implement new features using SDK. Can find me gainfully making lasting friendships with forward-thinking community members around DCL!
involvement:
I’ve been having a blast all around Decentraland attending events and creating lasting relationships with the various denizens of Decentraland. DCL has truly become a part of my everyday life, whether that’s creating new and challenging parkour courses for various brands around the space or taking a look at the new proposals and questions in the forums. I’ve even begun reading posts long forgotten to catch up on the history of the DAO and learning about my fellow members of the space.

It’s an honor to even be considered for receiving a delegation and would humbly serve the DAO with however much were to be presented. I aim to serve the community and fairly using the VP that would potentially delegated.

I think it’s been since Dec of '21 or maybe a little before, but I’ve sort of touched upon a little of how I have been involved, but my involvement continues to expand through various means in and out of Decentraland. I’ve met some wonderful people and have actively been bring more members to the space.

I shall continue to onboard new creators that I come in contact with all the knowledge I’ve amassed along my short, but fulfilling journey.
motivation:
I was actually reading a post that @yemel had commented on and there a link to this post was. I had seen it a few times when logging on, but hadn’t had the courage to make a post until reading that comment.: I believe delegation is a good way to give more voice to valuable members of our community. I took the time to review their applications and follow their participation in the government process. I encourage other big holders to do the same.

So thank you @yemel for your words, as they spoke volumes to me.

There’s nothing specifically that I wish to change, but what I want is more to the point of a voice within this community that I’ve become so enamored by. The success of the DAO is dependent upon the activity of it’s participants and only thrives properly with continued growth. I suppose that’s my goal in this matter, the continued and sustainable growth of Decentraland.
vision:
With Decentraland being the top tier Metaverse at this time, I see it being growing exponentially in the coming months and years as we see VR coming to the forefront. The immersion will increase and therefore the amount of time spent within the world.

I see more content being presented to the community and more of a cohesive society full of events and ways for the inhabitants to interact with one another.I see content being ever-increasingly important and believe we should do what we can to provide that content. I think it important that the DAO oversees the functionality of providing that future.
most_important_issue:
I think that there are two issues currently plaguing Decentralnd at the moment and will continue to be issues until they are no longer such. Governance and Content, the growth of the platform depends upon both. It all starts with the DAO and the voices that give it power.

Thank you for your consideration

bio: Aside form being the #1 Waifu jpg king. Featured in Forbes, Fox News, Huffpost, Techrunch and more Aaron Leupp and his company PromoAffiliates is most famous for acquiring millions of new users and millions of influencer views for his clients
involvement: Involved with DCL since Jan 2021, multiple Waifumon Parties a year in DCL since then!
motivation:
I’m already active in voting in the DAO and up to date with the latest in Decentraland. Through being a delegate I am to ensure the decentralized and creator empowered philosophy and most importantly encourage innovation as we grow.

Important areas of DAO participation consists of everything from Grant, to POI proposals. I also want to encourage less unnecessary rules and gate keeping. People are turning this into homework and school and this is suppose to be fun. In addition I aim to support proposals which promote accessibility, inclusivity, and diversity. Yes I copied a lot of this from Kevin but am making it my own.
vision: It will be the lead Metaverse in web3 space because it will finally be more Decentralized.
most_important_issue: Increase in activity and events in Decentraland. Less restrictions, bureaucracy and gatekeeping in Decentraland. More encouragement continued innovation!

bio: DG Discord Support Admin & DCL Wearables Designer.
involvement: Joined DCL about a year and half ago (on this address 0x4bCfB57149DD1E8eC510bc2CC490bC4C43C7Af8f before securing assets on a hardware wallet), after seeing an Ad from DG hiring for the positions of casino hosts. Quite interested in the metaverse, NFTs, P2E I started hopping around different venues around DCL like Wondermine, The Decentraland Report and Metazoo’s to name a few. Having no knowledge of wearables or even 3D modelling at all, became obsessed with wearables, joined a few groups, visited a few sites to gather info on these, created and submitted my first DCL wearable. Some of my contributions have been to continue publishing wearables, have minted a few names, collaborated with other community members on onboarding, wearables release, Parkour, events and giveaways. p.s very gratefull to all. Wearable references: https://forum.decentraland.org/t/collection-sannins-ninja-no-kunren-co-created-by-cryptsannin-is-ready-for-review/1707, https://forum.decentraland.org/t/collection-sannins-mummified-ninja-created-by-cryptsannin-is-ready-for-review/2259
motivation: The idea of delegation is very interesting to me, in this case the delegation of voting power with the intention of community involvement for its decision making and growth of platform helps with maintaning the integrity of the community as a whole. Although I participate in voting already. Reasons to be a delegate include supporting creator projects specifically building/developing DCL for the next users to come, involved with wearable making and community, have participated before (in other DAOs) and carry a nice understanding in general of these. Most importantly thinking on inclusivity and transparency by what it means to have more users debating and sharing ideas of growth.
vision: I see Decentraland as the most competent metaverse in Web3 currently, the possibilities/potential of creation and development that can merge are endless even with the many accomplishments DCL has been able to fulfill. I’d like to see the growth, we will witness in the years to come in DCL’s DAU, be accompanied with opportunities for those who are willing and devoted to keep providing value to the community. DAO’s role would still be to oversee these opportunities are not taken for granted, ensuring the treasury’s well being while development is prioritized and to provide an understanding of proposals enacted as well as trying to maintain inclusivity for DAO involvement for all members as more join. DCL progress so far since I joined has been more than outstanding, it’s difficult to think what could be going on in just 5 years. “Most people overestimate what can be done in 1 year and underestimate what can be done in 5 or 10”. Having this said, extremely bullish on DCL and my vision is DCL will grandfather metaverses as Bitcoin did for crypto currencies, in setting the standards of decentralization and possibilities.
most_important_issue: In my opinion the issue at hand is, users will keep joining we have seen and there’s not much one can do in DCL after some time.There’s an important question we must have in mind: What can we create for users to become involved with community as they enjoy DCL and keep logging in? DCL is the perfect platform for an “all-around” metaverse, for this we must maintain development diversity.

bio: I’m a 34 year old small business owner and a husband. I’m ‘dad’ to 4 beautiful dogs, 2 cats, and 3 chickens. – and a full time DCL community member striving to make a difference in the space. I spend 12+ hours in world.
relevant_skills: community building both in game and on social media
involvement: I joined in January 2021, but I took a break for several months over the summer, have been a DAU (Daily Active User) since late November 2021. During my time here my primary focus has been onboarding and guiding new users and supporting our amazing creators. I sponsored the creation of the RGB Wings produced by @AnomalousLTD and co-hosting the launch party with @SinfulMeatStick. I’ve since attended hundreds of events and always try to give back (quietly) to the community.
motivation: My biggest goal and the reason for applying for delegation is to protect the integrity of the space, to help prevent the abuse of grant proposals, to onboard new users, and to help educate new and existing users on the risks and concerns relating to cyber security via passing of deserving educational programs and proposals. I also feel it’s important to improve the functionality and accessibility of tools such as the user interfaces both in game, builder, and marketplace.
vision: Where do I see Decentraland in 5 years… Well, that is kind of a loaded question, as this space evolves at a much more rapid pace than the real world or the world of web 2. I see DCL of tomorrow as an ever-evolving world of endless possibilities, with equal opportunity for everyone to create, learn, earn, and grow. It will become a social platform where literally anything is possible for those who are willing to put forth the work. When I think of the next five years, I envision a virtual world where millions of users are able to interact and and collaborate. Decentraland will not only be a social platform but almost a fully functioning society, complete with its on art, fashion, music, entertainment, education, and celebration. There will be lands people visit for work, for school, for play, and to earn a living. Most importantly it will be a world where everyone is welcome and can be accepted for who they are, regardless of race, religion, sexuality, or gender identity. Decentralization doesn’t necessarily have to mean a free for all with no rules where there is freedom of consequence. It should always remain a hub of freedom from censorship, limited only by the guidelines and expectations of the community.
most_important_issue: Currently, the most pressing matter in my opinion is the onboarding of new users, but additionally the accessibility for those who are passionate about the world to be able to build and create.

bio: Hey I’m ck :wave: pronouns they/them. I’m a Creative Director in Advertising with 15 years experience working on ad campaigns for brands such as Major League Soccer, Instagram, Adidas, and Activision. I’m also a Nail Artist creating avant garde art for your digits both IRL and in DCL. I’ve been in crypto since 2017 — when I bought my first coins and NFTs — and am so amazed by where we have come/where we will go!
relevant_skills: Community Manager + Admin + Leader for the Community Building Decentraland Discord
involvement: Since joining DCL in Mar 2022, I have won a fashion grant where I worked with Michi Todd to create a wearable based around my idea and sketch/presentation/brand ethos(bubbles aka ckbubbles). We also collabed on assets for the Face Fashion House base build, and threw a bubble themed gala to present the collab. I’ve also created two nail art wearables(in the earring slot) with another designer ManaDaiquiri, that have opened up what I hope to be a future wearable slot when the potential hand category comes. I’m working on a nail art pop up right now to present those two wearables. In addition, I’m taking on a role as a Marketing Director for Metatrekkers community NFT project in DCL, working on their Beatrekkers DJ competition liaising the DJ community in DCL with the NFT team, and programming wellness/mindfulness experiences in their club house. I also help admin and create in the Community Building Decentraland discord, which brings many large communities of DCL together to grow DCL through a collective front. And lastly, I am a part of the ABC DCL stream team created by BillyTeacoin that explores DCL through Adventures highlighting our favorite and new locations with Awed Job and myself, the basics of DCL and helping onboard, and finding Chill moments to relax and find mindfulness in DCL.
motivation: I am active in the DAO, and often vote and interact with many proposals, POIs, and polls almost daily. I seek to help create a more fair voting system, as so often you see little engagement in the DAO compared to the number of DAU, except through those that hold extreme amounts of VP. This makes it more difficult for those who are not as politically or financially well off in their time in DCL. I also bring my own expertise in certain aspects of a lot of proposals I’ve been seeing lately, relating to concepting creative, advertising/marketing, managing budgets and teams, production both digital and on set, post production in static and videos assets, etc. A lot of people look to me for advice and my opinions on proposals either they submit or have seen, as I bring an educated, rational and logical perspective to how I approach what I read in the DAO.
vision: This is quite a lofty question, that I’m not sure a comment on a forum post can really speak to, but my plan since joining and becoming part of the community, has been to grow this community and space. I think we need to get The Foundation support in their endeavors, so the small team that is doing wonderful things, can also work at a much higher capacity. Because when the boom of new users comes, the infrastructure needs to be able to manage that flow. We need to work on making it easier for people to engage and understand crypto, that continues to be a huge barrier for DCL new users. I’d like to see campaigns for DCL that help drive awareness and bring about education for the world. And I’d love to see more community involvement from The Foundation and those involved. We had some of y’all join our chats last week, and it really brought about a sense of understanding and trust that I feel has maybe been missing. And we need to think beyond 5 years. If we want a platform that has longevity, We need to be many steps ahead of the rest of the metaverses and real world. I see the DAO and the community working together to build, not separate entities that are expecting the other side to handle some of the work. I think we should be having these conversations together, and holding each other accountable. No one really knows who should be doing what and how, and that leaves so many in the dark about the capabilities and opportunities that can exist here.
most_important_issue: Bringing in new users and upping the DAU, But honestly in order for that focus to then be manifested and properly benefited from, we need to make sure the platform could handle a boom of people, and then focus on how we make it easy and not as hard to figure out how to function in the world of crypto.

bio: I’m a K-8 Technology Specialist Educator. I teach children how to operate crypto-wallets, make NFTs, and build virtual spaces. Online since 1993 on the Mosaic browser. I create massive multiplayer performance art like https://return2.me 1, sketch-it: August 2006, and Flowers of Light and Love on Vimeo 1. I lead with my heart into spaces where genuine, human, interconnection is the goal.
involvement: I arrived in December 2021. Actively posted about my first time wearable creation experience in the forum (link) 1. Posted a poll about increasing the facial diversity of avatars in DCL that was rejected (link). I listen to and participate in at least 4 Twitter spaces about DCL each week. I will re-listen to the spaces and annotate the discussions by tweeting the time stamp and a description of topic. In partnership with Wisher Vodka and nine other land owners I hosted a scavenger hunt called “Finding Whimsy”. Nearly 30 people participated for over 3 hours. They solved clues and followed instructions leading them all over Decentraland. Everyone who figured out they needed to go to Asian Plaza on the Artemis server and found the faerie queen, Whimsy, won a variety of prizes like the Spotlight emote and wearables from a number of talented creators. I am one of three co-hosts of ABC Decentraland Adventures (created by BillyTeacoin), a weekly guided tour of new and interesting places streamed on Twitch. We talk to the owners, developers, and animators who work to create a richer experience. After streaming two hour episodes for eight weeks, we have toured 47 different locations with an average of 30 visitors joining us in world.
motivation: I will be the voice of the hundreds of thousands of krill to balance out the few whalesI am a bridge between brand new users and daily active users who have been around since DCL pixels first hit the eyeballs of the public. I take the time to meet new people visiting Decentraland for the first time. I answer their questions and give them small tasks to complete so they can learn by experience. We keep communicating via Twitter, Telegraph, and Discord. We plan outings to learn and have fun. I seek out existing users and learn about their contributions. I ask them what their plans are for the future of this space. Encourage people to start doing things rather than looking for DAO approval. Money is only one resource needed to actualize a dream. Creativity and hard work are good substitutes for under-funded visionaries. Explore a reputation-based VP for voting. The people who spend the most time in the world building, developing, creating, socializing, and networking gain VP to vote on changes. There are more kinds of capital than crypto. I’d like to include experience, knowledge, wisdom, and time as factors in calculating voting power. I’d like the DAO to be more representative of the people that visit DCL. I’d like the people who visit DCL to look more like the citizens of the world.
vision: Encourage a million flowers to bloom. Free “experimental” land for everyone to play with and learn how to build and develop using the SDK. Extensive and up-to-date docs and video tutorials in multiple languages. People need to be able to see themselves in the virtual realm before they will want to enter it. Increase the diversity of facial characteristics, body types, genders, and body abilities of the avatars. Utilizing IPFS to store and serve assets for DCL. This will truly decentralize and make more sturdy the content of the world. Spinning up a Catalyst server on AWS still puts us in the realm of single point of failure. (What do you want to see? What is the role of the DAO in it?) The DAO’s role is to support the community in their projects and to get out of the way the rest of the time. Not to insert itself everywhere but only in places that it can accelerate a process or add value.
most_important_issue: Increasing and retaining Daily Active Users. (What challenges will we face in the next 12 to 24 months?) The fiat to Mana bottleneck is limiting the flow of capital into Decentraland. Are we going to continue telling the new potential user, “No. Sorry. We don’t want any of your money.”? After a person can see themselves in a world, they want to own a piece of that world. If we put a huge wall in the way of everyone wanting to get their own piece, they will leave and take their money with them. That piece can be as simple as buying a hat in the marketplace.

bio: Hi! I’m Canessa and I’ve been a Decentraland citizen since 2019. I’ve been a land owner for over 3 years, and I was a winner of the first Land Creator Contest in 2019. More recently I’ve been working to grow Decentraland and hope to inspire others to do the same.
relevant_skills: community building both in game and on social media
involvement: I joined in January 2021, but I took a break for several months over the summer, have been a DAU (Daily Active User) since late November 2021. During my time here my primary focus has been onboarding and guiding new users and supporting our amazing creators. I sponsored the creation of the RGB Wings produced by @AnomalousLTD and co-hosting the launch party with @SinfulMeatStick. I’ve since attended hundreds of events and always try to give back (quietly) to the community.
motivation: My biggest goal and the reason for applying for delegation is to protect the integrity of the space, to help prevent the abuse of grant proposals, to onboard new users, and to help educate new and existing users on the risks and concerns relating to cyber security via passing of deserving educational programs and proposals. I also feel it’s important to improve the functionality and accessibility of tools such as the user interfaces both in game, builder, and marketplace.
vision: Where do I see Decentraland in 5 years… Well, that is kind of a loaded question, as this space evolves at a much more rapid pace than the real world or the world of web 2. I see DCL of tomorrow as an ever-evolving world of endless possibilities, with equal opportunity for everyone to create, learn, earn, and grow. It will become a social platform where literally anything is possible for those who are willing to put forth the work. When I think of the next five years, I envision a virtual world where millions of users are able to interact and and collaborate. Decentraland will not only be a social platform but almost a fully functioning society, complete with its on art, fashion, music, entertainment, education, and celebration. There will be lands people visit for work, for school, for play, and to earn a living. Most importantly it will be a world where everyone is welcome and can be accepted for who they are, regardless of race, religion, sexuality, or gender identity. Decentralization doesn’t necessarily have to mean a free for all with no rules where there is freedom of consequence. It should always remain a hub of freedom from censorship, limited only by the guidelines and expectations of the community.
most_important_issue: Currently, the most pressing matter in my opinion is the onboarding of new users, but additionally the accessibility for those who are passionate about the world to be able to build and create.

bio: My Name is Sinful I am one of Decentralands Twitch streamers. I have been in the space for 8 months. I am a show host , content creator, Twitter Space host with Canessa. I am a believer of this ecosystem and I am here for the long run.
relevant_skills: I facilitate the onboarding of new users to DCL as well as mold the new user experience
involvement: I am one of Decentralands most active Twitch streamers, I have a following of 2.7k on Twitch and 1.2k on YouTube. I use my Twitch platform to welcome, help, and onboard new members into our community. I Host a weekly show called “Beyond The NFT” which has been going strong for 19 weeks straight, where I have interviewed some of Decentralands most iconic figures : Roustan, Aaron Leupp, Tangpoko, Micheal K, DoctorDrip and the list goes on! I host weekly Decentraland Community Building Twitter Spaces with Canessa, and I am Founder of the Community Building Decentraland (CBD) Discord server where our Decentraland community members are actively engaging with one another in efforts to build a brighter Decentraland. I am active on web3 Twitter Spaces always inviting artist, singers, and creators to join us and explore the possibilities this space has to offer. I actively Engage in the DAO, always placing my vote on what I feel is best for Decentrland. I also organize and host events for community members that lack the resources.
motivation: I want to be a guardian to our community , My goal is to preserve the integrity of Decentraland by supporting projects whose team members have invested their time and efforts to our community. I strive to protect the investments made into this ecosystem by both old and new users, and want to do my part to ensure we have a vibrant ecosystem where everybody’s voice is heard. I will contribute in making sure DAO Funds are used for the good of Decentraland and do my part to preserve the integrity of our DAO , So that the DAO may continue to help Community projects build for years to come. Through my DAO votes I hope to contribute toward the Decentraland our community members want to be in.
vision: I may be a dreamer when it comes to my 5 year vision for Decentrland, In 5 years I see Decentrland having all the tools and resources needed to allow users to jump into Decentraland and be able to find the knowledge they are looking for. I envision an inclusive space welcoming to everyone and anyone I see a big strong vibrant community where everyone’s voice and opinions matter. Esteban Ordano Co-Founder of Decentraland about 3 weeks to a month back joined The Decentraland Community Building Twitter Space Canessa and I host and made a comment that really stuck with me about handling toxicity in Decentraland 'It’s so lovely to hear that the community self heals in a way, It blew my mind that someone was trolling, and everybody started to say “good Morning” instead of engaging with the troll and being toxic' This comment really resonated with me because his words have me a glimpse of his vision of having a strong and loving community. It was nice to see that my visions aligns with one of Decentralands founders vision.Another quote by Esteban that really caught my attention was 'it’s not the foundations job to dictate how the world is ran, it’s the community’s job to tell them what type of world they want dcl to be'. I was vary moved by these words because he is right! It is our job as the community to bring to life the world we want to see and it is our actions today that will dictate the world we see tomorrow.
most_important_issue: I think the most important issue Decentraland faces is the lack of Docs/videos, and resources to help make the onboarding process for new users smooth and painless . Furthermore the resources need to be readily available and easy to access. I strongly Believe content in every language is a necessary step for Decentraland to be able to truly call its self a global Metaverse , of course my personal belief is that this should be a community lead effort and the DAO should be used only as support.

bio: Founder of LifeOfMusk NFT and MetaTrekkers NFT, Texas Blockchain Council ambassador and Decentraland reporter
involvement: Present as an early adopter through various investments for almost two years, I’ve owned land for a year and transformed it into a successful PoI story. Since then, our project has attracted and onboarded countless metaverse enthusiasts, and has always advocated for both the educational and investment aspects of Decentraland. Our direct involvement with the community can be seen through a year of constantly organizing events, parties, webinars, courses, and art exhibitions.
motivation: One of MetaTrekkers’ main purposes is to make Decentraland a widespread social interaction environment that at the same time provides viable revenue, job, education, and investment solutions to all users, equally.
vision: I want to see visionary projects being developed, the kind that erases the boundaries between the metaverse and the real world, making it a seamless experience for the user, where they get to enjoy the best of what both worlds have to offer. And I think this future is possible only through the expansion of DAOs into more aspects of life.
most_important_issue: In order to evolve, Decentraland needs to bring in a constant stream of new users and provide them with unique monetization solutions. It won’t be easy, especially due to the prolonged crypto crisis. Still, in order to become a truly open-source, constantly developing DAO, Decentraland has to overcome an important challenge: move from a trendy, hot topic, to a self-sustaining, stable, organic growth environment driven solely by its users, with equal voting and decision powers.

bio: Hi! My name is Maryana, a DCL citizen since 12/2021. I am a Twitch streamer, content creator, and a Decentraland Reporter. I co-founded metaverse networking & consulting company, BVERSE. I am also the CMO for The Ocean Meta NFT project.
relevant_skills: Streaming/Hosting (via Twitch/Twitter Spaces and Clubhouse, and DCL events)
Linkedin engagement for Metaverse related content
involvement: I have been in Decentraland for 6 months now (I first entered on 12/23/2021). Since then, I have been able to achieve the following: Led & Moderated early discord servers such as the Rich Homie Gang. I continue to lead BVERSE, the Ocean Meta, and engage in the Decentraland Report. - Co-hosted a few events in the community (i.e., Community Metaverse Fashion Week with MetaParty & Nikki Fuego’s Vroom Vroom Grand Prix). -Speaker for two Ukrainian Fundraisers for MetaParty & Dogman to raise funds for Ukraine via wearable sales. -Streamed Decentraland content on Twitch. -Decentraland Reporter (May 2022) & interview members of the Community. -Co-founded BVERSE, a metaverse consulting company & networking to onboard businesses and build a business professional community. -Host Twitter Spaces, collaborate with business & NFT projects, moderate Discord. -Launched 4 wearables on marketplace (2 dresses, 1 diamond heel, sunflower aura). -Event planner for events (i.e., Maryana wearable launch party, Community Drone Gallery, Ocean Meta NFT Launch party, Twitter Spaces). -Entered video into DCL Film Club. -Learn SDK (still learning), courtesy of Last Slice. -Engage& vote in DAO proposals. -Network with various companies, NFT projects, individuals on Clubhouse, Twitter Spaces, Linkedin, Discord, and in real life. -I have been supporting users by purchasing wearables, attending events, and promoting proposals, games, wearables and events. -Active in the community, create engaging posts on Twitter and Instagram
motivation: Currently, I hold about 300 VP (name claims, mana in wallet), and would like to have more female representation in the Decentraland DAO, given my continuous support and presence in the Decentraland community. Unfortunately, I do not own land currently. I have been one of the few active females in the community, wanting to bring value and growth into Decentraland. I have been volunteering my time outside of my job to create content, reach out & build meaning relationships outside of Decentraland of potential projects/businesses to enter DCL. I want to help contribute to proposals being passed, should they have the right “potential” needed for Decentraland to succeed. Also, coming from a finance background, I believe I possess the skills to properly assess projects, its budgets, in an independent, unbiased way. I have 4 years of external/internal auditing skills that allow me to question the controls in place and credibility of a user/entity. I want to help ensure that proposals are sufficiently documented, or that each project is represented fairly, and are detailed with budgets. I want to make sure due diligence & research is done on each proposal prior to voting, and ensuring our DCL stakeholders (i.e., landowners) are being properly represented in their investment. In terms of the DAO, I want to ensure point of interests are being properly approved, proposals are enacted sufficiently, funds are used correctly, and updates are sufficiently provided. I also want to make sure the right mix of proposals are being created (i.e., budgeting the “kinds” of grants that get passed quarterly).
vision: I see Decentraland being a leader in the Metaverse of showing what is possible to achieve as a creator in Web 3/blockchain. I want to show that diversity and female representation is achievable in the platform. Ultimately, my 5-year vision is to see brands enter Decentraland and want to stick around due to the QUALITY of the community members, not quantity. (Currently, we are facing a user retainment issue at the time of posting, making it harder to find more quality new users. I also want to see more of Decentraland’s land being developed with different experiences. I want Decentraland to be known as a metaverse where there are education parcels (i.e., universities, self-learning), gaming, galleries, retail, office space and more exist and is possible to achieve in a co-existed space. I want to see Decentraland content being on all “broadcasting screens” of the web (TikTok, Pinterest, Reels, Linkedin, Reddit, WSJ). I want to see a community genuinely wanting to help in advertising and onboarding users into Decentraland. I want to see more events that represent global representation of all people of different ethnicities. I also want to see more transparency and tools created for the marketplace, better land stats for businesses to utilize in their KPIs and assessment of engagement in Decentraland.
most_important_issue: believe retaining users and providing resources for new users is one of the most important issues. Retaining businesses in Decentraland is very much so important as well, since these brands are out there “vouching” for the metaverse experience. Another issue we currently face is the lack of marketing and education to the masses of the internet about what Decentraland is, and what the benefits are to join this platform. More content needs to be on social media platforms like TikTok, IG, YouTube, Linkedin, Reddit, Pinterest, etc. There should be more consideration in incentivizing reasonable creator grants/affiliates and believe that there needs to also be more experiences created for all users and backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, and hobbies/interests of all types of people. Currently, there is not enough experiences or content within the algorithms of the internet to market Decentraland. There is also a high barrier to enter (i.e., computer software, types of mediums DCL currently is on (currently only browser and client at the time of writing). I believe the infrastructure of DCL also needs to be enhanced (servers, loading times, scene radius/loads, as well as the consideration of DAO VP for active users/creators, not just landowners. Additionally, a social platform should be considered within the platform, so users do not have to always communicate outside in Decentraland.

bio: As a serial entrepreneur, Gonzo got his start at Rutgers School of Business. While pursuing a dream in Medicinal Marijuana and founding his own Holistic Hemp company, Gonzo helped many people free of charge. Gonzo worked to help build a Criminal Defense law firm in Denver Colorado. As an avid gamer and digital designer, Gonzo opened his own Web Design & Video Marketing Firm in 2020. As a proficient computer wizard, Gonzo is helping others to lead the way in the development of Web3 business, as well as the expansion of the virtual frontier. As of 2022 Gonzo is currently working with some of the best design studios in the world on multiple projects that include 3D Animation, Large scale NFT Creation, and Game Asset Design.
involvement: Ive been involved in DCL for a year. Love the community. Part of slices of the metaverse. They help a lot of people get started. Took part in the christmas event in 2021 as well as the 837x event from samsung. I was lucky enough to get a pair of shoes, and it got me thinking.
motivation: I want to give back and help the community grow. As i can afford land and dont have much money. This seems like the best option. I would love to see more engagements. Help to add to the community and help people, not troll them. Id like to build a place where other like minded people can gather , shop, whatever. Im interested to see how the 3d design changes in the future.
vision: Id like to see DCL become the go to metaverse for first timers and people interested in the metaverse. Not corporations but people figuring stuff out for themselves, without being censored. I love the fact that someone can build whatever they are capable of designing. WE plan on making some cool shit.
most_important_issue: probably barriers to entry. DCL needs to be more user friendly for creators as well as not so savy tech people. The Average joe.

bio: Founder of the Wilderness P2E game & DAO Optimist
involvement: Joined in Dec 2021 and applied for a small (3k$) grant to build a game. - Launched Wilderness P2E within a month and have been growing the Wilderness P2E and Decentraland Community ever since.
motivation: Support Promising New Projects : Having started my journey with a grant from the DAO, I would like to give back by utilising my ability to identify potentially long term successful projects.- Support Developers in DCL : Developing in DCL for over half a year has put me in the right spot to be able to understand the processes and the technical requirements of different systems of decentraland.
vision: The incubation hub for 3D experiences. I would imagine several giant startups to emerge out of building new 3D experiences for billions of people in this next era of internet.
most_important_issue: New User Onboarding - Attracting and Supporting Talented Developers - Not enough participation by the community when it comes to decision making or contributing solutions to the platform.

bio: I am Nikki Fuego! I am a Drag Queen, Wearable Creator, Content Creator, and Game Creator. I have called DCL my home since November of 2021. Top-Seller for Metaverse Fashion Week 2022.
involvement: I’ve been involved since late November 2021. There hasn’t been a day go by that I haven’t been involved with the community since then. I made my first wearable in December 2021. In January 2022 I made 56 wearables and February 2022 I made 48 wearables. I released 4 Fashion Week exclusive collections and sold out of all 4 collections. I created the first car wearable in Decentraland called VroomVroom and have created an entire brand around it aside from my Drag brand. I held an in-game event centered around the VroomVrooms that featured racing elements in those wearables. We gave away three 1:1 Unique helmet wearables to those winners. That community movement created Vroomway. We applied for a tier 4 grant and were approved with just over 2M VP and 160+ Yes votes. Our goal is to introduce more fun ways to utilize wearables while also introducing more dynamic vehicle experiences. I help people learn blender and troubleshoot with people 1:1 in the community to help them get better with their 3D modeling. I’m all about less competition and more collaboration. I’m involved with many Twitter Spaces and Discord Communities to help push the community forward. I am constantly looking at proposals in the DAO and helping advocate for inclusion, representation, transparency, and trust. I’m not afraid to speak my mind when it comes to things that I disagree with especially when it impacts a community I care so much about and call home.
motivation: I think it’s really important for the community to feel like it has balanced control over how the platform will develop. Representation of that control is super important too. As a Trans person, representation is everything. The community I’ve been a part of and built around my wearables is something I have never experienced before in my life. I have felt so accepted and loved in every aspect (aside from the common trolls) of the community. My life has drastically changed. Since joining DCL, I have been able to make dreams a reality. It really has impacted me for the good. I am happy with where my life is right now. Even with challenges, I feel supported for the first time ever. I’ve been working a full-time job running a customer support department for a start-up for almost 2 years now and also balancing this while creating this journey within Decentraland. Because of how impactful Decentraland has been on my life, I feel the desire to protect and fight for it! If I could help replicate this experience I’ve had for even just one person, I would feel eternally fulfilled. That only happens with representations in these issues. About a month ago I was a very vocal speaker on the wearable submission fee and I truly feel like I spoke for a community of non-typical creators. Speaking up for those creators who feel powerless and speaking up for the newbies who feel overlooked. To be heard by the foundation and DAO really spoke volumes too. They took the communities thoughts into consideration regardless of VP, but I know that is not always the case. Decisions focused on changing the platform for the good, should not fall to the wallets of a few, but rather the community and those willing to stand for it. I’m grateful to even be considered for it. I wanna see the DAO become more integrated with the community itself. As it stands, we are in a constant education battle with the common player. The second they hear VP as a barricade, they are detached and uninterested. I believe as a community we can change that and make it practical for all citizens of any capacity. Isn’t that what web3 is all about? Creating a future worth being excited about :D!
vision: In the next 5 years, I see Decentraland being the leading social space but without all the KYC data harvesting. I see Decentraland being a leading metaverse as it is now. Just seeing how the platform has changed in the short 8 months I’ve been here, the platform has a shining future ahead of it. I see us leading the way in what an immersive and dynamic metaverse can be. We already achieved that with Fashion Week this year. The fact that Meta acknowledged our efforts as a community spoke volumes to me. I see the micro-communities within Decentraland coming together and really collaborating to engineer progression that replicates all the things we love about the platform to new people. I see us changing lives and bringing true freedom to people that have never experienced that before. I truly believe that we will be THE platform for creatives and gamers. We have a lot of passionate developers and game creators that we can easily fill all 90,000 parcels with never before seen experiences! Brick by brick!
most_important_issue: Security and education surrounding that security. As someone who is fairly new to the crypto and web3 space, there is a monolith of information to learn. To me we are in a similar spot to when credit/debit cards merged with the internet. When people were first using their credit cards online, they were being hacked left and right. I remember my Grandpa would always get mad when me and my cousin would want to buy a computer game because of the few times he was hacked doing so. I have been victim to two hacks now during my 8 months. In the first hack, I lost $900+ and in the second hack, I temporarily lost 2 names. I know my experiences are minimal in comparison, but to the average person who doesn’t have the same determination to keep moving, this has caused hundreds of people to leave the web3 space entirely without even having a chance to experience the things that are worth staying for. I believe this can be tackled with education first, then protocols proceeding. We need to rally as an entire community and build up our confidence to spot these hacks before anything is lost. The majority of the people entering the industry in the last two quarters are not those of web3 background or programming background. Because of that, education is a requirement in order for Decentraland to grow and be appealing to the masses. There are solutions, we just have to come together and find them! I think once we have more games, more in-world experiences, and more security we can really appease the masses and onboard more and more players! This platform is big enough for mainstream media and we are only a stone’s throw away! Anyway that I can help bring repeat and new attention to DCL, I will! My Vroomway project aims to provide a safe place for every player and play style for people, new and repeating, to experience! Brick by brick there isn’t anything we as a community can’t do! :smiley:
